titles.title: O LORD, Our Lord, in All the Earth

comments.comment: This hymnal has not been proofed - data may be incomplete or incorrect

verse.name: v1
verse.lines: O LORD, our Lord, in all the earth, how excellent Thy name! Thy glory Thou hast spread afar in all the starry frame.

verse.name: v2
verse.lines: From lips of children, Thou, O LORD hast mighty strength ordained, that adversaries should be stilled and vengeful foes restrained.

verse.name: v3
verse.lines: When I regard the wondrous heav'ns, Thy handiwork on high, the moon and stars ordained by Thee, "O what is man?" I cry.

verse.name: v4
verse.lines: O what is man, in Thy regard to hold so large a place, and what the son of man, that Thou dost visit him in grace.

verse.name: v5
verse.lines: On man Thy wisdom hath bestowed a pow'r well nigh divine; with honor Thou hast crowned his head with glory like to Thine.

verse.name: v6
verse.lines: Thou hast subjected all to him, and lord of all is he, of flocks and herds, and beasts and birds, and all within the sea.

verse.name: v7
verse.lines: Thy mighty works and wondrous grace Thy glory, Lord, proclaim, O Lord, our Lord, in all the earth, How excellent Thy Name.
